metadata.title: Sample Background Theories for FOL Infrastructure
metadata.description: Example axioms demonstrating the JSON format for the Background Theories system

axioms.title: Relation between primed and unprimed predicates
axioms.english: p is true of x if and only if there is an eventuality e that is the eventuality of p being true of x and e really exists
axioms.implementation_notes: This is the fundamental connection between facts and eventualities

axioms.title: Set Union Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 s2) (iff (union s s1 s2) (forall (x) (iff (member x s) (or (member x s1) (member x s2))))))
axioms.english: s is the union of s1 and s2 if and only if for all x, x is a member of s iff x is a member of s1 or x is a member of s2
axioms.implementation_notes: Defines set union in terms of membership

attributes.name: predicate_name
attributes.description: The name of the predicate this eventuality represents

entities.name: set
entities.description: Mathematical sets from traditional set theory

attributes.name: elements
attributes.description: The elements contained in this set

predicates.name: Rexist
predicates.description: Entity really exists in the real world

arguments.name: e
arguments.description: The entity that may really exist

predicates.evaluation_logic: Check if the entity has been marked as really existing

predicates.name: member
predicates.description: Element is a member of a set

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The element that may be in the set

arguments.name: s
arguments.description: The set that may contain the element

predicates.evaluation_logic: Check if the set contains the element

predicates.name: union
predicates.description: First set is the union of the second and third sets
predicates.evaluation_logic: Check if first set equals union of second and third sets
